item.title: Design teardown: reimagining email - InVision Blog
item.description:
Design teardown: reimagining email - InVision Blog

Ever kept track of the amount of time you spend each week reading, writing, and organizing email? Dealing with email is a major cognitive load-and often a real productivity killer. Earlier this year at Cubeit, we did a short design sprint-just for fun-to see if we could come up with a better way to handle email.

item.title: The most important 'F' word
item.description:
The most important 'F' word

Speechwriters make our living with words, so we're not usually at a loss for them. But recently I turned a group of speechwriters into a slack-jawed, inarticulate mess when I threw the F-word into a conversation. No, not that F-word. I asked them how they have Fun. "What do

item.title: Netflix just changed its icon [Updated]
item.description:
Netflix just changed its icon [Updated]

Netflix looks is gearing up to change its icon. The company is sporting a completely new design on its Facebook and Twitter accounts. For comparison, here's the old one: There are two major differences. Aside from the ribbon pattern (hey, that's familiar!)

item.title: The Best Response to 'Sell Me This Pen'
item.description:
The Best Response to 'Sell Me This Pen'

It's a classic pair of scenes. Leonardo DiCaprio, playing former stockbroker Jordan Belfort in he Wolf of Wall Street , takes a pen out of his pocket and challenges top sales executives to sell him that pen.

item.title: Customer Experience vs User Experience: Why the difference matters
item.description:
Customer Experience vs User Experience: Why the difference matters

User experience is not the same as customer experience. While most designers directly influence the UX, they also need to understand the larger context of the CX. The customer experience represents every step of the journey from when users are running price comparisons, to when users try the product, to when users may resort to customer service if their needs aren't met.

item.title: How to deal with a small design budget - InVision Blog
item.description:
How to deal with a small design budget - InVision Blog

"I want my website to look like Apple." Ever heard a client say something like that during the early phase of a project? What most people don't realize is that companies like Apple employ huge design teams that work with nearly unlimited resources.

item.title: Brand New: New Logo and Identity for MasterCard by Pentagram
item.description:
Brand New: New Logo and Identity for MasterCard by Pentagram

Established in 1966 (as Interbank until 1968 and later known as Master Charge until 1979), MasterCard is a technology company in the global payments industry that - contrary to the perception that they issue credit cards - processes the payments between the banks of merchants and the card-issuing banks or credit unions of the purchasers.

item.title: 9 Geheimen voor betere fotografie op het strand
item.description:
9 Geheimen voor betere fotografie op het strand

Fotograferen in de buitenlucht is altijd leuk, maar aan het strand vind ik het altijd extra bijzonder. Je kunt er continu experimenteren met licht, water, mensen, dieren, grote composities of juist hele kleine details. Het strand, de zee en de duinen vormen altijd een fraai decor voor je foto's.

item.title: Brand New: New Logo and Identity for Ahold Delhaize by Futurebrand
item.description:
Brand New: New Logo and Identity for Ahold Delhaize by Futurebrand

Established this past Friday, Ahold Delhaize is one of the world's largest food retail groups with 22 different supermarket brands that account for 6,500 grocery and specialty stores in 11 countries. The new company is the result of a merger between Netherlands-based Ahold, established in 1887, and Belgium-based Delhaize Group, established in 1867, now collectively employing more than 375,000 people worldwide.
